snippet: Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas, which treated the only Ebola patient to die in the United States, will pay his relatives an undisclosed sum and create a charitable foundation in his name, the family’s lawyer said Wednesday.
abstract: Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas, which treated Ebola patient Thomas Eric Duncan, has agreed to financial settlement with his family and creation of charitable foundation in his name; relatives had been critical of care Duncan received, saying his death was partly due to his race and lack of insurance.
lead_paragraph: Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas, which treated the only Ebola patient to die in the United States, will pay his relatives an undisclosed sum and create a charitable foundation in his name, the family’s lawyer said Wednesday.

headline.main: Texas: Ebola Victim’s Family to Be Paid by Hospital
headline.print_headline: Texas: Ebola Victim’s Family to Be Paid by Hospital
